Author Sarah Godfrey
was ranked as one of the top "16 Inspiring Embroidery Artists to Follow on Instagram" on BrownPaperBag.com
Looking for new ways to add a wow factor to your embroidery? Discover how to create fresh, eye-catching embroidery designs on sheer fabric with
Organza Hoop Art

Using sheer fabric and a few adjustments to basic embroidery techniques, author Sarah Godfrey's approach is perfect for both beginners and experienced stitchers. Anyone can accomplish this exciting embroidery style without feeling intimidated! Featuring twelve patterns, clear step-by-step instructions, gorgeous photography, tips on designing your own embroidery, and so much more, this book will help you to achieve one-of-a-kind embroidery hoops!

Author Sarah Godfrey is an acclaimed fiber artist, designer, and owner of The Lake of Spring where she sells patterns, embroidery kits, and finished hoops. She was featured in the "Top 100 Embroidery Artists" on BeautifulBizarre.net. Sarah's eye-catching embroidery designs are nothing like you've ever seen before—they cast unique, dynamic shadows depending on the angle of the light shining through.

Inside this inspiring guide, you'll discover the magic of embroidering on organza, with botanical, nature-inspired, and animal designs from simple ladybugs, goldfish, and toadstools to a more intricate flowering cactus, flowerpot, and floral wreath. These beautiful designs are truly one-of-a-kind—and all on organza! The helpful opening section includes useful information on tools and materials and 10 tutorials for need-to-know stitches and techniques.
Try the exciting style of embroidering on sheer fabric, and see your stitches in a whole new light, with
Organza Hoop Art

Organza Hoop Art

Book Description

Add a wow factor to your embroidery and discover fresh, eye-catching embroidery designs! Using sheer fabric and a few adjustments to basic embroidery techniques, author Sarah Godfrey’s approach is beginner-friendly so anyone can accomplish this exciting embroidery style. Featuring 12 botanical and whimsical patterns, step-by-step instructions, and so much more, see your stitches in a whole new light!
From the Back Cover
Sheer Fun with Embroidery!
Discover the magic of embroidering on organza! Perfect for both beginners and experienced stitchers,
Organza Hoop Art

is an inspiring guide to creating eye-catching embroidery designs on sheer fabric. With a helpful opening section on tools and materials, author and embroidery artist Sarah Godfrey walks you through 10 tutorials for need-to-know stitches and techniques. From there, she presents 12 skill-building projects that are nothing like you've ever seen before! Featuring clear, step-by-step instructions, coordinating photography, and full-size patterns, each project will inspire you to take your embroidery to the next level. From simple ladybugs, goldfish, and toadstools to a more intricate flowering cactus, flowerpot, and floral wreath, these designs are truly one-of-a-kind—and all on organza!

About the Author
Sarah Godfrey

is an embroidery artist, illustrator, and designer with a passion for color, texture, and the beauty of nature. She is the owner of The Lake of Spring online shop, where she offers downloadable embroidery patterns, art prints, finished hoops, and one-of-a-kind upcycled garments. In 2020, she was selected as the Artist in Residence at the Schneider Haus National Historic Site, where her solo exhibition focused on her hand embroidery, block printing, and illustration work. To see more of her art, visit her website (TheLakeOfSpring.com), Etsy (thelakeofspring), or Instagram (@thelakeofspring). When she's not pursuing her artistic practice, she works full-time in Marketing in Ontario, Canada where she lives with her husband and son.
